alert.note: Alert for St. Charles; St. Louis; St. Louis City (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 16 at 2:59PM CDT until July 16 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Calhoun County in southwestern Illinois... St. Louis City in east central Missouri... Northeastern St. Charles County in east central Missouri... St. Louis County in east central Missouri... * Until 345 PM CDT. * At 258 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near St. Charles to near Augusta, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... St. Louis, St. Charles, Florissant, Chesterfield, Wildwood, University City, Ballwin, Kirkwood, Maryland Heights, Hazelwood, Webster Groves, Ferguson, Arnold, Manchester, Creve Coeur, Overland, Clayton, Jennings, St. Ann, and Crestwood. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 261 and 277. Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 228 and 231. This also includes Babler Memorial State Park, Scott Joplin Historic Site, Route 66 State Park, Castlewood State Park, and First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: St. Charles; St. Louis; St. Louis City
